member.name: T:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler
member.summary: Server side handler for the jQuery File Upload. Must be added in Web.config to function.

member.name: M:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.NextUniqueFilename(System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds the next unused unique (numbered) filename.
member.param: Function that will determine if the name is already in use
member.returns: The original filename if it wasn't already used, or the filename with " (n)" added to the name if the original filename is already in use.

member.name: M:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.WriteFileListJson(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.FileData})
member.summary: Writes the file list as JSON to the httpcontect, setting content type and encoding.
member.param: The uploaded files to write out.

member.name: M:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.SaveUploadToDisk(System.Web.HttpPostedFile)
member.summary: Saves the uploaded file to the temp folder with the right extension and a temporary file name.
member.returns: The path to the saved file

member.name: M:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.ProcessPresentation(System.String)
member.summary: Unzips the file, loops through the slides and adds them as pages
member.param: The path to the zip file containing the presentation.

member.name: M:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.GetSessionStore(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Get session storage for list of uploaded files. Creates dictionary if missing.

member.name: T:JQueryFileUpload.UploadHttpHandler.FileData
member.summary: Container for all the data we need to know about an uploaded file, including data for redisplay in the uploader, and where the temp file is saved.
